results.title: A Self made hero = Un Heros tres discret
results.creator_credit: Aliceleo, Lumière, France 3 Cinema, M6 Films, Initial Groupe (FR), Cofimage 7, Patrick Godeau and Jacques Audiard
results.brief_description: At the end of World War II, Albert, a rather dim-witted French man, finds himself in the unenviable position of having contributed nothing to the war effort. In fact he actively resisted involvement in the French Resistance, despite the fact that his hometown was under the command of the Nazis, and his wife and father-in-law assisted English pilots. To amend matters Albert flees to Paris, where under the tutelage of a real fighter, he reinvents himself as a bone-fide Resistance member. Albert’s deceit brings him accolades, friends and even romance and he revels in his newfound glory. His deception however is in danger of exposure as his stature grows and his increasingly complex and bold lies unfurl. Using actual footage from the war years, “A self made hero” is a warm and funny film about one man’s self-delusion and determination to reinvent himself as the brave and admirable person he wishes he were. The film addresses issues of patriotism and post-war accusations that saw the persecution of many in France. A semi-documentary style is employed, displaying the point that histories are often determined after the fact. Mathieu Kassovitz (director of La Haine) displays a deft touch as the misguided Albert. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: A Selection of early films: 1896-1913
results.creator_credit: BFI, Louis Lumiere, Georges Melies, Cecil Hepworth, Emile Cohl, Ferdinand Zecca and Edwin S. Porter
results.brief_description: This selection is designed to illustrate the main stages in the development of the cinema in Britain from the first public performance in 1896 to 1913, when the full-length feature film became firmly established. Titles featured in this compilation are: ‘Train entering a station’ by Lumiere; ‘The Indiarubber head’ by Melies; ‘Queen Victoria’s funeral’; ‘The Revolving table’ by Hepworth; ‘Answering a call’, ‘The Burning stable’ by Hepworth, ‘The Great Train robbery’ by Porter; ‘The Well washed house’ by Zecca; ‘Drama among the puppets’ by Cohl; with extracts from ‘Simple Charity’ by Griffiths and ‘Dante’s Inferno’ and East Lynne.

results.title: A Selection interview. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Joe Scully and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description:
In this film we follow one nervous applicant and the members of a selection panel to the interview room. The selection interview covers the educational background of the applicant, job expectation, the candidate’s handling of certain situations and their interests, abilities and perception of their present job. Cast includes Peter Whittle, Tony Leadley, John Warwick, Marcia Waite, Richard Meckle.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: A Secret place
results.creator_credit: College of Art, Nicholas Oughton, Kim Cardow and Susan Jones
results.brief_description: Shows the outdoor play environment at the Lady Gowrie Child Centre in Brisbane where children can take advantage of conditions not always available. Tree-houses, streams, mud pools and a variety of animals combine to make this natural environment. Shows how children can interact with even the simplest part of this environment.

results.title: A Second chance
results.creator_credit: Australian Film and Television School and Virginia Westbury
results.brief_description: A film about rehabilitation of coronary patients, designed primarily for the cardiac patient and his family to help with the re-adjustment necessary on both sides after a coronary incident.

results.title: A Search for learning
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Joseph Koenig and Donald Shebib
results.brief_description: A film for teachers, describing the use of the “discovery method” in teaching. All it needs is a teacher whose encouragement is natural and unobtrusive. The film shows a free environment where even the furniture can be arranged to meet the needs of a particular inquiry. Film loops and other visual media are shown being used to advantage in this method of teaching.

results.title: A Search for anti-worlds
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Berkeley Film Associates and Philip Dauber
results.brief_description: Documents the course of physics research experiments at the Lawrence Berkeley Laboratory of the University of California, which seeks to determine the existence of large amounts of antimatter in the universe.

results.title: A Sculptor's landscape: Henry Moore
results.brief_description: An interpretation of the work of Henry Moore, made in close collaboration with him. The work of the artist is revealed in a series of striking visual studies, with a simplicity and directness that may surprise people who feel that abstract art is unrelated to humanity and the world generally. Commentary by Sir Ralph Richardson and music is based on electronic instruments and the use of special effects.

results.title: A Scream from silence = Mourir a tue-tete
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Gagne and Anne-Claire Poirier
results.brief_description: This feature film documents the rape and eventual suicide of Suzanne, a nurse whose physical and emotional health deteriorates beyond repair as a result of the violence inflicted on her. Images of ritual and mass rape reinforce the horror of this act of domination. In this docudrama drawn from case histories, the filmmaker explores social attitudes that cause women to feel guilty for being raped. It touches upon the physical, emotional, spiritual and legal aspects of this crime. Cast includes Luce Guillbeault, Germaine Houde, Michele Mercure. (Awards: Chicago; Houston.)

results.title: A Scrap of paper and a piece of string
results.creator_credit: John Korty and Exploring for the National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: An animated film about a scrap of paper which boasts of being more useful than a piece of string. However, after turning into a paper boat and getting blown over in the water, the paper finds the string of use after all. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
